mewbot.core package¶

Module contents¶

The core interface definitions for mewbot.

This module provides a set of types that can be checked at runtime, allowing components to be developed.

This module contains:

  • Interfaces for IO components (IOConfig, Input, Output)

  • Interfaces for behaviours (Behaviour, Trigger, Condition, Action)

  • Base classes for InputEvent and OutputEvent, and type hints for the event queues.

  • Component helper, including an enum of component types and a mapping to the interfaces

  • TypedDict mapping to the YAML schema for components.

class mewbot.core.ActionInterface(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Protocol

Actions are executed when a Behaviour is Triggered, and meets all its Conditions

Actions are executed in order, and will do some combination of:

  • Interact with DataSource and DataStores

  • Emit OutputEvents to the queue

  • Add data to the state, which will be available to the other actions in the behaviour

async act(event: InputEvent, state: Dict[str, Any]) → None¶

Performs the action.

The event is provided, along with the state object from any actions that have already run for this event. Data added to or removed from state will be available for any further actions that process this event. No functionality is provided to prevent processing more actions.

bind(queue: Queue) → None¶

Attaches the output to the bot’s output queue.

A queue processor will distribute output events put on this queue to the outputs that are able to process them.

static consumes_inputs() → Set[Type[InputEvent]]¶

The subtypes of InputEvent that this component accepts.

This is used to save computational overhead by skipping events of the wrong type. Subclasses of the events specified here will also be processed.

static produces_outputs() → Set[Type[OutputEvent]]¶

The subtypes of OutputEvent that this component could generate

This may be checked by the bot to drop unexpected events. It may also be used to verify that the overall bot config has the required outputs to function as intended.

class mewbot.core.BehaviourConfigBlock¶

Bases: dict

YAML block for a behaviour, which includes the subcomponents

actions: List[ConfigBlock]¶
conditions: List[ConfigBlock]¶
implementation: str¶
kind: str¶
properties: Dict[str, Any]¶
triggers: List[ConfigBlock]¶
uuid: str¶
class mewbot.core.BehaviourInterface(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Protocol

add(component: TriggerInterface | ConditionInterface | ActionInterface) → None¶

Adds on of the components to this behaviour.

Note that the order of Actions being added must be preserved.

bind_output(output: Queue) → None¶

Wrapper to bind the output queue to all actions in this behaviour. See mewbow.core.ActionInterface:bind_output()

consumes_inputs() → Set[Type[InputEvent]]¶

The set of InputEvents which are acceptable to one or more triggers.

These events are not guaranteed to cause the Behaviour to be activated, but instead save processing overhead by pre-filtering events by their type without having to invoke the matching methods, which may be complex.

async process(event: InputEvent) → None¶
Processes an event.

  • Check whether one (or more) Triggers match the event.

  • Check whether all conditions accept the event

  • Run the actions in order

class mewbot.core.ComponentKind(value)¶

Bases: str, Enum

Enumeration of all the meta-types of Component that a bot is built out of. These all have a matching interface above (except for DataSource and Template which are not yet implemented, but in the specification)

Action = 'Action'¶
Behaviour = 'Behaviour'¶
Condition = 'Condition'¶
DataSource = 'DataSource'¶
IOConfig = 'IOConfig'¶
Template = 'Template'¶
Trigger = 'Trigger'¶
classmethod interface(value: ComponentKind) → Type[IOConfigInterface | TriggerInterface | ConditionInterface | ActionInterface | BehaviourInterface]¶

Maps a value in this enum to the Interface for that component type

classmethod values() → List[str]¶

List of named values

class mewbot.core.ConditionInterface(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Protocol

A Condition determines whether an event accepted by the Behaviour’s Triggers will be passed to the Actions.

Each condition makes its decision independently based on the InputEvent. The behaviour combines the results to determine if it should take the actions.

Note that the bot implementation may ‘fail-fast’, and a condition may not see all events.

allows(event: InputEvent) → bool¶

Whether the event is retained after passing through this filter.

static consumes_inputs() → Set[Type[InputEvent]]¶

The subtypes of InputEvent that this component accepts.

This is used to save computational overhead by skipping events of the wrong type. Subclasses of the events specified here will also be processed.

class mewbot.core.ConfigBlock¶

Bases: TypedDict

Common YAML Block for all components

implementation: str¶
kind: str¶
properties: Dict[str, Any]¶
uuid: str¶
class mewbot.core.IOConfigInterface(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Protocol

Configuration component that defines a service that mewbot can connect to.

An IOConfig is a loadable component with configuration for interacting with an external system. The config provides Input and/or Output objects to the bot, which interact with that system via the event queues.

For example, an IOConfig for a chat system would take a single set of login credentials, and provide an Input that reads messages and an Output that sends messages.

get_inputs() → Sequence[InputInterface]¶

Gets the Inputs that are used to read events from the service

Returns:

The Inputs that are used to read events from the service (if any)

get_outputs() → Sequence[OutputInterface]¶

Gets the Outputs that are used to send events to the service

Returns:

The Outputs that are used to send events to the service (if any)

class mewbot.core.InputEvent¶

Bases: object

Base class for all events being generated by Input

Events are put on the InputQueue and are then processed by Behaviour

This base event has no data or properties. Events must be immutable.

class mewbot.core.InputInterface(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Protocol

Class for performing read from a service

Inputs connect to a system, ingest events in some way, and put them into the bot’s event queue for processing by the behaviour.

bind(queue: Queue) → None¶

Allows a Bot to attach the active input queue to this input.

static produces_inputs() → Set[Type[InputEvent]]¶

List the types of Events this Input class could produce.

async run() → None¶

Function called for this Input to interact with the service.

The input should not attach to the service until this function is called.

Note:

  • This function will be run as an asyncio Task.

  • This function should be run after bind() is called.

  • This function may be run in a different loop to __init__.

mewbot.core.InputQueue¶

alias of Queue

class mewbot.core.OutputEvent¶

Bases: object

Base class for all events accepted by Output

EventQueue

This base event has no data or properties. Events must be immutable.

class mewbot.core.OutputInterface(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Protocol

Class for performing read from a service

The bot’s output processor takes events from the behaviours off the output queue, and passes it to all Outputs that declare that they can consume it.

static consumes_outputs() → Set[Type[OutputEvent]]¶

Defines the types of Event that this Output class can consume

async output(event: OutputEvent) → bool¶

Send the given event to the service.

Parameters:

event – The event to transmit.

Returns:

Whether the event was successfully written.

mewbot.core.OutputQueue¶

alias of Queue

class mewbot.core.TriggerInterface(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Protocol

A Trigger determines if a behaviour should be activated for a given event.

A Behaviour is activated if any of its trigger conditions are met.

Triggers should refrain from adding too many sub-clauses and conditions. Filtering behaviours is the role of the Condition Component.

static consumes_inputs() → Set[Type[InputEvent]]¶

The subtypes of InputEvent that this component accepts.

This is used to save computational overhead by skipping events of the wrong type. Subclasses of the events specified here will also be processed.

matches(event: InputEvent) → bool¶

Whether the event matches this trigger condition
